summary: Child workflows are not automatically inheriting the parent workflow's namespace, requiring manual propagation despite documentation suggesting it should work automatically. This breaks custom namespace configurations until explicitly passed through ChildWorkflowOptions.
userImpact: Users working with custom namespaces (especially Temporal Cloud) must manually propagate namespace to child workflows or use interceptor workarounds, breaking expected inheritance behavior.
rootCause: ChildWorkflowOptions initializes namespace to ClientOptions::DEFAULT_NAMESPACE instead of inheriting the parent workflow's current namespace context.
proposedFix: Modify ChildWorkflowOptions to automatically inherit the parent workflow's namespace when not explicitly specified, similar to how TaskQueue is already being transferred.
workaround: Manually pass namespace through workflow parameters or use a WorkflowOutboundRequestInterceptor to set namespace on all child workflow requests.
resolutionDetails: The fix ensures namespace is inherited from parent workflow context even when users don't explicitly specify it in ChildWorkflowOptions.
keyQuote: Namespace should be inherited even when the user has specified options for a ChildWorkflow that don't include a custom Namespace value.
